intro: Reichardia intermedia, commonly known as the common rockcress, is a flowering plant native to Europe, Asia, and North Africa. It is a member of the Brassicaceae family, which includes many other flowering plants with small, four-petaled flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or dry soils and is often found in mountainous regions. Its leaves are alternate, simple, and usually have a rough texture. Reichardia intermedia produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, followed by pods that contain several seeds.
